text:
From a beer hawk mystery case. Pours clear and golden. Thin head. Nice fresh hop smell. Says it's a lager but I would say more like a nice craft bitter. Lovely bitter hop finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 330ml. [ As Fyne Ales Christmas On The Beach ].Clear medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, grain, moderate hoppy, grass - green grass. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, sweet malt, grass - green grass, pale malt, grain. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20161128]
 6-3-6-3-13
Bottle from eebria.com. Golden colour with a thick white head. Aroma is grassy and light citrus. Taste is light fruity sweet.

Creamy white head stayed on a very active, translucent, golden body.
Fruity aroma with melon hints.
Medium bodied, smooth on the palate, slight cloying.
Tropical fruits, kiwi, lemon , citrus & bitter aft.
Very hoppy. One of the best Lagers Ive had.

Bottle 33cl. poured into a lager glass. Clear pale to medium golden, tall frothy white head, good retention, good lacing; fresh fruity nose, aroma grain, lemon, orange peel, grass; taste light sweet and bitter, fruity, grainy, citrus; mild dry bittersweet finish, citrus notes; light to medium body, oily texture, average carbonation; quite nice and crisp lager but I dont see the link with Xmas.
Bottle at home. Clear golden. Nose is light fruits, grass. Tastes crisp, light, pale malts, light bitter, light fruity. Ok.

330ml bottle. Clear golden colour with a small white head. Aroma: hoppy, malt, citrus, lemon, kiwi, orange. Taste: hoppy, fruity, pale malt, light sweetness and mildly bitter finish. Fairly smooth mouthfeel, light-medium body, low carbonation. Really decent lager.

Bottle shared in London. Cheers! Pours totally clear yellow with a frothy, white head. The nose holds dried lemon peel, crispy biscuits, straw. Light sweet flavour with more crispy biscuits, a little white bread crust, pale grains, mild grassy bitterness. Light bodied with airy carbonation. Finishes with husky grains, light grass, lemon rind, crisp biscuits. Not bad.
330ml bottle from Hippo Beers. Golden yellow, reasonable head. Corn resin aroma. Dry grain flavour. Bitter aftertaste. Good example of style.
Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. Pale golden coloured with malty, grassy and tropical fruit flavours followed by a sweet floral and grapefruit finish. Very Good.

Bottle shared in ABZ. It pours clear gold with a medium white head. The nose is fresh, clean, grassy, juicy, kiwi, limeade, candied peel and lemon sherbet. The taste is crisp, clean, grassy, light herbal vibe, paper, zesty lemon, pithy lime and cracker with a firm, dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Crisp, clean and bitter. Good lagerbier.

bottle at home .. golden amber ... massive white head .. soft floral fruit.. light peppery fruit nose ... det zezty fruits .. light herbal bitter fruit ... dry zezty peppery fruits ... zezty lemon.. i proabably shouldnt like this but i do
330ml bottle from Appellation Wines, cheers Ash!. Pours clear pale gold with a thick, frothy white head. Aromas of citrus, white grape. Taste is set, fruit. Light grassy, astringent finish. Decent.
Bottle at home. Pours clear golden, nose is pineapple, tropical fruit, toffee, taste is dry, toffee, floral.
330ml bottle at home, shared with Stuartyboy, from Good Spirits Company, West Nile Street, Glasgow, grassy, pale malty aroma, golden with no head, lagery, grapefruit, moderately bitter finish.
Bottle shared with Mr_H a clear pale golden ale with lager type aroma some pepper green hop lager malts quite pithy and bitter

Bottle from BottleDog, Edinburgh. Clear golden body with a thin white head. Lively carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of grain, orange peel, green pepper and grass. Flavour of pear, pithy orange and a light bitterness on the finish. Thin body with an oily mouthfeel. Soft fizz. Nice, but less interesting than I thought it might be.

Bottle from Appellation Wines Comely Bank.
Appearance - golden with gentle bubbles and a proportionate head.
Nose - grapefruit and fresh sweat.
Taste - more of the same. Quite pithy.
Palate - light bodied with a creamy yet bitter middle section and a fairly fresh finish.
Overall - I loaded this as a Helles as there wasnt team bitterness of a pils even though the dry hopping gave bitter citrus fruit.
